author.description: The name of the package author.

email.description: The email address of the author or maintainer.

username.description: The username of the GitHub account hosting the repository.

repo_name.description: The name of GitHub repository, if different to :conf:`modname`.

pypi_name.description: The name of project on PyPI, if different to :conf:`modname`.

import_name.description: The name the package is imported with, if different to :conf:`modname`.

classifiers.description: A list of `"trove classifiers" <https://pypi.org/classifiers/>`_ for PyPI.

keywords.description: A list of keywords for the project.

short_desc.description: A short description of the project. Used by PyPI.

source_dir.description: The directory containing the source code of the project.

enable_tests.description: Whether tests should be performed with pytest.

enable_releases.description: Whether packages should be copied from PyPI to GitHub Releases.

enable_pre_commit.description: Whether pre-commit should be installed and configured.

docker_shields.description: Whether shields for docker container image size and build status should be shown.

docker_name.description: The name of the docker image on dockerhub.

python_deploy_version.description: The version of Python to use on Travis when deploying to PyPI, Anaconda and GitHub releases.

python_versions.description: A list of the version(s) of Python to use when performing tests with Tox, E.g.

manifest_additional.description: A list of additional entries for ``MANIFEST.in``.

py_modules.description: A list of values for ``py_modules`` in ``setup.py``, which indicate the single-file modules to include in the distributions.

console_scripts.description: A list of entries for ``console_scripts`` in ``setup.py``. Each entry must follow the same format as required in ``setup.py``.

additional_setup_args.description: A dictionary of additional keyword arguments for :func:`setuptools.setup()`. The values can refer to variables in ``__pkginfo__.py``. String values must be enclosed in quotes here.

extras_require.description: A dictionary of extra requirements, where the keys are the names of the extras and the values are a list of requirements.

additional_requirements_files.description: A list of files containing additional requirements. These may define "extras" (see :conf:`extras_require`). Used in ``.readthedocs.yml``.

setup_pre.description: A list of additional python lines to insert at the beginnning of ``setup.py``.

platforms.description: A case-insensitive list of platforms to perform tests for.

rtfd_author.description: The name of the author to show on ReadTheDocs, if different.

preserve_custom_theme.description: Whether custom documentation theme styling in ``_static/style.css`` and ``_templates/layout.html`` should be preserved.

sphinx_html_theme.description: The HTML theme to use for Sphinx.

extra_sphinx_extensions.description: A list of additional extensions to enable for Sphinx.

intersphinx_mapping.description: A list of additional entries for ``intersphinx_mapping`` for Sphinx. Each entry must be enclosed in double quotes.

sphinx_conf_preamble.description: A list of lines of Python code to add to the top of ``conf.py``. These could be additional settings for Sphinx or calls to extra scripts that must be executed before building the documentation.

sphinx_conf_epilogue.description: Like :conf:`sphinx_conf_preamble`, but the lines are inserted at the end of the file. Intent lines with a single tab to form part of the ``setup`` function.

html_theme_options.description: A dictionary of configuration values for the documentation HTML theme. String values must be encased in quotes.

html_context.description: A dictionary of configuration values for the documentation HTML context. String values must be encased in quotes.

enable_docs.description: Whether documentation should be built and deployed.

docs_dir.description: The directory containing the docs code of the project.

tox_requirements.description: A list of additional Python requirements for Tox.

tox_build_requirements.description: A list of additional Python build requirements for Tox.

tox_testenv_extras.description: The "Extra" requirement to install when installing the package in the Tox testenv.

travis_extra_install_pre.description: Additional steps to run in Travis before installing dependencies.

travis_extra_install_post.description: Additional steps to run in Travis after installing dependencies.

travis_pypi_secure.description: The secure password for PyPI, for use by Travis

travis_additional_requirements.description: A list of additional Python requirements for Travis.

enable_conda.description: Whether conda packages should be built and deployed.

conda_channels.description: A list of Anaconda channels required to build and use the Conda package.

conda_description.description: A short description of the project for Anaconda.

additional_ignore.description: A list of additional entries for ``.gitignore``.

yapf_exclude.description: A list of additional files or directories to exclude from ``yapf`` autoformatting.

tests_dir.description: The directory containing tests, relative to the repository root.

pkginfo_extra.description: A list of lines of Python code to add to the top of ``conf.py``. These could be additional settings for Sphinx or calls to extra scripts that must be executed before building the documentation.

exclude_files.description: A list of files not to manage with `repo_helper`.

imgbot_ignore.description: A list of additional glob ignores for imgbot.

mypy_deps.description: A list of additional packages to install in Tox when running mypy. Usually type stubs.

pure_python.description: Flag to indicate the package is pure Python

stubs_package.description: Flag to indicate the package is a PEP 561 stubs package.

on_pypi.description: Flag to indicate the package is available on PyPI

mypy_plugins.description: A list of plugins to enable for mypy.

enable_devmode.description: Enable `Python Development Mode`_ when running tests.

use_experimental_backend.description: Whether to use ``repo_helper``\'s experimental build backend, rather than ``setuptools.build_meta``.

pre_commit_exclude.description: Regular expression for files that should not be checked by pre_commit.
